message: is it like that in epio.ini?
or my paste of it here at least
app ID?
'stores'
ehmm, right. and it seems to. typo, never mind...
yeah, that's probably the only way for now
hmm, getting an error after all: [cron] Invalid time specifation 'sync_something '//example.com/example.xml some_param = 0 2 * * **' for 'app/manage.py sync_something http'
no, the syntax in ini files is pretty particular
ah, of course, colon is also a valid delimiter
/name
can i just single quote the url as in regular cron job commands?
I have this management task that imports an XML file and parses it. It would need to run daily. having a bit of trouble with the [cron] format though. i would expect this line to work:
in your pasted error the last two asterisks have no space between them
app/manage.py sync_something http://example.com/example.xml some_param = 0 2 * * *
no just in the error
@tijs you have two equals signs in the line, it's splitting on the first
.... http = //media ....
that's actually a colon not an equal sign as in http://media...
hmm, so how do i pass a URL as a parameter to the management command then?
not sure you can with the current syntax; I'm just checking that ConfigParser has no option for this
we're going to move the configuration file to JSON at some point soon, we think, but that'll be a few weeks at least
no problem
ok thanks. guess i'll have to add the urls to setting, that would work too i guess.
ok thanks for the help. not that much of an issue for this project but good to find the root cause :)

hey @andrewgodwin one more thing... it can't find 'app/manage.py'. from the 'djangoproj/manage.py' example in the docs i was assuming i had to use the app/ dir to point to my django project since that would be the default path ep.io uses for projects right? i'm not using the checkout option... any hints?
@tijs No, exclude the app dir if your django project is directly in the root of your checkout. That example assumes your django project is inside a folder in your repository.
@andrewgodwin ok great, thanks!
